content.raw: looks good to me, just some changelog conficts
content.html: looks good to me, just some changelog conficts

content.raw: I only have a minor API proposal below, but this looks good to me either way.
content.html: I only have a minor API proposal below, but this looks good to me either way.

content.raw:
Since we're updating the API, there's one little detail that bothers me in this class and we could improve it. Some functions are called `*Vector3*` while others are `*Vector3d*`. I'm fine with either of them, it would just be nice to be consistent.

How about changing the new public functions to `SetVector3dWidgetValue` and `Vector3dWidgetValue` and also changing other private functions like `UpdateVector3dWidget`?
content.html:
Since we're updating the API, there's one little detail that bothers me in this class and we could improve it. Some functions are called *Vector3* while others are *Vector3d*. I'm fine with either of them, it would just be nice to be consistent.

How about changing the new public functions to SetVector3dWidgetValue and Vector3dWidgetValue and also changing other private functions like UpdateVector3dWidget?

content.raw: I sometimes wonder about all these public members here. Maybe this is the time to ask this question, do we want to make them private? It's probably going to be a lot of work.
content.html: I sometimes wonder about all these public members here. Maybe this is the time to ask this question, do we want to make them private? It's probably going to be a lot of work.

content.raw: Do we need Reflection and FieldDescriptor here?
content.html: Do we need Reflection and FieldDescriptor here?

Instead of copying the whole function we could reduce code duplication by calling the new functions from the old ones, something like this:

std::string ConfigWidget::GetUnitFromKey(const std::string &_key,
    const std::string &_jointType)
{
  return this->UnitFromKey(_key, _jointType);
}

What do you think?

Fixed them in 8d71f22 and 6283f44.
